page.title: 10The Stafforshire Way
page.content: Starting at the National Trust land surrounding the Castle, is a footpath that stretches down through the county. Eventually it will go the whole length. It starts at the Castle and then crosses the road to the 'Old Man of Mow', a solitary pillar of rock left by the quarrymen. From here it it travels to the north east following the ridge that lies between Mow Cop and Congleton Edge. Near the top right of this block the footpath descends down towards Marsh Green and Biddulph. Way walking is a popular past-time and the number of long distance footpaths are increasing as time passes. There are splendid views both north over Cheshire and south over the Potteries.
